info.description: The Azure SQL Database management API provides a RESTful set of web APIs that interact with Azure SQL Database services to manage your databases. The API enables users to create, retrieve, update, and delete databases, servers, and other entities.
info.title: SqlManagementClient

get.description: Lists sync agents in a server.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the resource. You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the server on which the sync agent is hosted.
parameters.name: serverName

parameters.description: The subscription ID that identifies an Azure subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The API version to use for the request.
parameters.name: api-version

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of sync agents.

nextLink.description: Link to retrieve next page of results.

items.description: An Azure SQL Database sync agent.

expiryTime.description: Expiration time of the sync agent version.

isUpToDate.description: If the sync agent version is up to date.

lastAliveTime.description: Last alive time of the sync agent.

syncDatabaseId.description: ARM resource id of the sync database in the sync agent.

default.description:
*** Error Responses: ***

 * 400 InvalidSyncGroupCreateOrUpdateRequest - The create or update sync group request body is empty.

 * 400 InvalidSyncMemberCreateOrUpdateRequest - The create or update sync member request body is empty.

 * 400 InvalidSyncAgentCreateOrUpdateRequest - The create or update sync agent request body is empty.

 * 400 InvalidDatabaseResourceId - Invalid database resource identifier.

 * 400 MismatchingSubscriptionWithUrl - The provided subscription did not match the subscription in the Url.

 * 400 InvalidSyncAgentResourceId - Invalid sync agent resource identifier.

 * 400 MismatchingResourceGroupNameWithUrl - The provided resource group name did not match the name in the Url.

 * 400 MismatchingServerNameWithUrl - The provided server name did not match the name in the Url.

 * 400 InvalidSyncAgent - Sync agent is invalid.

 * 400 CannotDeleteInUseSyncAgent - Cannot delete sync agent because it is used by sync member.

 * 400 InvalidSyncMetadataDatabase - Sync metadata database is invalid.

 * 404 SubscriptionDoesNotHaveServer - The requested server was not found

 * 404 DatabaseDoesNotExist - User has specified a database name that does not exist on this server instance.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the resource. You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The API version to use for the request.
parameters.name: api-version

202.description: Deleting the sync agent is in progress.

204.description: The specified sync agent does not exist.

default.description:
*** Error Responses: ***

 * 400 InvalidSyncGroupCreateOrUpdateRequest - The create or update sync group request body is empty.

 * 400 InvalidSyncMemberCreateOrUpdateRequest - The create or update sync member request body is empty.

 * 400 InvalidSyncAgentCreateOrUpdateRequest - The create or update sync agent request body is empty.

 * 400 InvalidDatabaseResourceId - Invalid database resource identifier.

 * 400 MismatchingSubscriptionWithUrl - The provided subscription did not match the subscription in the Url.

 * 400 InvalidSyncAgentResourceId - Invalid sync agent resource identifier.

 * 400 MismatchingResourceGroupNameWithUrl - The provided resource group name did not match the name in the Url.

 * 400 MismatchingServerNameWithUrl - The provided server name did not match the name in the Url.

 * 400 InvalidSyncAgent - Sync agent is invalid.

 * 400 CannotDeleteInUseSyncAgent - Cannot delete sync agent because it is used by sync member.

 * 400 InvalidSyncMetadataDatabase - Sync metadata database is invalid.

 * 404 ResourceNotFound - The requested resource was not found.

 * 404 SubscriptionDoesNotHaveServer - The requested server was not found

get.description: Lists databases linked to a sync agent.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the resource. You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the server on which the sync agent is hosted.
parameters.name: serverName

parameters.description: The name of the sync agent.
parameters.name: syncAgentName

parameters.description: The subscription ID that identifies an Azure subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The API version to use for the request.
parameters.name: api-version

200.description: Successfully retrieved sync agent linked SQL server databases.

schema.description: A list of sync agent linked databases.

nextLink.description: Link to retrieve next page of results.

items.description: An Azure SQL Database sync agent linked database.

databaseId.description: Id of the sync agent linked database.

databaseName.description: Database name of the sync agent linked database.

databaseType.description: Type of the sync agent linked database.

description.description: Description of the sync agent linked database.

serverName.description: Server name of the sync agent linked database.

userName.description: User name of the sync agent linked database.

default.description:
*** Error Responses: ***

 * 400 InvalidSyncGroupCreateOrUpdateRequest - The create or update sync group request body is empty.

 * 400 InvalidSyncMemberCreateOrUpdateRequest - The create or update sync member request body is empty.

 * 400 InvalidSyncAgentCreateOrUpdateRequest - The create or update sync agent request body is empty.

 * 400 InvalidDatabaseResourceId - Invalid database resource identifier.

 * 400 MismatchingSubscriptionWithUrl - The provided subscription did not match the subscription in the Url.

 * 400 InvalidSyncAgentResourceId - Invalid sync agent resource identifier.

 * 400 MismatchingServerNameWithUrl - The provided server name did not match the name in the Url.

 * 400 InvalidSyncAgent - Sync agent is invalid.

 * 400 InvalidSyncMetadataDatabase - Sync metadata database is invalid.

 * 404 SubscriptionDoesNotHaveServer - The requested server was not found

 * 404 DatabaseDoesNotExist - User has specified a database name that does not exist on this server instance.
